intro: Sloanea clemensiae, commonly known as the Ecuadorian sloanea, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features elliptical, leathery leaves with a glossy surface and produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink. Sloanea clemensiae is adapted to high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions with well-drained soil. Its ornamental value and ecological significance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
